event.title: was incorporated into the Roman Empire in 178 and 177 BC

data.event: The Piran peninsula was incorporated into the Roman Empire in 178 and 177 BC and settled in the following years with rural homes (villae rusticae).

event.title: 5th century AD onward, and incursions by the Avars and Slavs at the end of the 6th century, prompted

data.event: The decline of the Roman Empire, from the 5th century AD onward, and incursions by the Avars and Slavs at the end of the 6th century, prompted the Roman population to withdraw into easily defensible locations such as islands or peninsulas.
